definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]

sentences.english: The disclosure of relevant information is made by addi…
sentences.chinese: 相关信息披露主要是通过会计报表附注实现。

sentences.english: Note the compendious final life of the emperors and their descendants who had great impact on the history.
sentences.chinese: 历史上有较大影响的帝王及其后裔附注其简明结局。

sentences.english: Don't look at the corner of the hidden, one is light shallow love note?
sentences.chinese: 在看不清的角落里，藏着的那一个轻浅的爱的附注？

sentences.english: Commitments that are material in amount should be disclosed in notes to the financial statements.
sentences.chinese: 金额较大的承付款项应在财务报表的附注中揭示。

sentences.english: Movements in Designated Funds of the Association are shown in Note 16 to the financial statements.
sentences.chinese: 本会各项特定基金之变动详列于财务报表附注16内。

sentences.english: You can add annotations to attributes, and observe events for them.
sentences.chinese: 您可以将附注加入至属性，并为其观察事件。

sentences.english: The notes on pages 22 to 42 form part of this interim financial report.
sentences.chinese: 第22至42页之附注构成本中期财务报告的一部份。

sentences.english: I have read through the content and remarks on this application form.
sentences.chinese: 本人已详阅此申请表之内容及附注。

definition: marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
